wcagViolations.description: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds
wcagViolations.fix: Increase color contrast ratio to at least 4.5:1. The primary button color (#9f5fff purple) has insufficient contrast with white text (#f8f8f8). Solutions: (1) Darken the purple to #7c3fd9 or darker, (2) Use a darker text color like #000000, or (3) Add a text-shadow for improved readability.

elements.issue: Link has no visible text, aria-label, aria-labelledby, or title attribute
Link has no visible text, aria-label, aria-labelledby, or title attribute

wcagViolations.fix: Add aria-label to social media icon links. Example: <a aria-label="Follow us on GitHub" href="https://github.com/repotoire">. This provides screen reader users with context about the link destination.

wcagViolations.wcagCriteria: WCAG 2.1 Level A - 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value

elements.issue: Combobox button has no accessible name
Combobox button has no accessible name

wcagViolations.fix: Add aria-label to combobox buttons. Example: <button type="button" role="combobox" aria-label="Select category" aria-controls="...">. For Radix UI components, ensure you're using the Radix Primitives correctly with proper labeling patterns.

issues.description: Combobox buttons on Marketplace page lack accessible names
issues.recommendation: Add aria-label attributes to all combobox/select components. For Radix UI Select components, wrap the trigger in a Label or add aria-label directly to the Trigger component.

issues.description: Primary button color (#9f5fff) has insufficient contrast (3.55:1) with white/off-white text across all pages
issues.recommendation: Update the primary color in your Tailwind/CSS configuration. Current: #9f5fff (contrast 3.55:1). Recommended: #7c3fd9 or darker (contrast 4.5:1+). Alternatively, change text color from #f8f8f8 to pure white #ffffff or pure black #000000 depending on the final background color choice.

issues.description: Social media icon links (GitHub, Twitter/X) in footer lack accessible text
issues.recommendation: Add aria-label to all icon-only links. Screen reader users need to know the purpose of each link. Example:

issues.description: No skip-to-main-content link found for keyboard users
issues.recommendation: Add a visually-hidden skip link as the first focusable element on the page. This allows keyboard users to bypass navigation and jump directly to main content.
issues.codeExample:
// In your main layout or header component Skip to main content // In your main content area
{/* page content */}

issues.description: Some interactive elements are smaller than the recommended 44x44 pixel minimum touch target size
issues.wcagCriteria: WCAG 2.1 Level AAA - 2.5.5 (not required for AA, but best practice)
issues.recommendation: Ensure all buttons, links, and interactive elements are at least 44x44 pixels. Found: (1) Element with 178x32px, (2) Element with 36x36px. Increase padding or minimum dimensions.
issues.codeExample:
// Tailwind classes for minimum touch targets
className="min-h-[44px] min-w-[44px] inline-flex items-center justify-center"

issues.description: All tested pages are fully keyboard navigable with visible focus indicators
issues.recommendation: No action needed - keyboard navigation is working well. All interactive elements are reachable via Tab/Shift+Tab, no keyboard traps detected, and focus indicators are visible.

issues.description: Proper heading hierarchy detected on most pages (single h1, proper h2/h3 nesting)
issues.recommendation: Continue maintaining proper heading hierarchy. Ensure each page has exactly one h1 and headings don't skip levels (e.g., h1 -> h3).

issues.description: Good use of semantic HTML5 elements (header, nav, main, footer) detected
issues.recommendation: Continue using semantic HTML5 elements and ARIA landmarks for better screen reader navigation.

keyFindings: Color contrast issues with primary purple button (#9f5fff) across all pages - affects readability for users with low vision
Missing ARIA labels on icon-only links (social media) - inaccessible to screen reader users
Missing ARIA labels on combobox buttons (Marketplace page) - critical accessibility barrier
No skip-to-main-content link - inconvenient for keyboard-only users
Some touch targets below 44x44px minimum - difficult for users with motor disabilities
Keyboard navigation works well with visible focus indicators
Proper semantic HTML structure with landmarks
